review_title: Current employee with HFSC for almost 10 years
job_title: Registered Nurse in New Britain, CT
pros:
HFSC is a rewarding place to work.  We care for a difficult patient population, but we do it as a team.  There are always opportunities to advance your nursing practice within the hospital and there is tuition reimbursement available for furthering your education.  For non-clinical staff, HFSC will cross-train between positions and provide necessary education.  Support staff and management listen to concerns and do their best to troubleshoot issues as they arise.

I have stayed with HFSC for this long because we really do make a difference and I love being a part of this team!
cons: Our healthcare benefits and 403B could be improved.

job_title: Behavior Specialist

cons: Biggest downfall is AIU. Does not promote a positive work environment; Lead staff talk down to behavioral specialist staff and speak negatively in regards to the families that are in the program. Behavioral specialists provide more direct care than they do therapy. Often understaffed and extremely poor training.
